metadata.title: CVE-2016-2533 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Buffer overflow in the ImagingPcdDecode function in PcdDecode.c in Pillowbefore 3.1.1 and Python Imaging Library (PIL) 1.1.7 and earlier allowsremote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a crafted PhotoCDfile.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2533` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-imaging - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3.2
python-imaging-compat - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3.2
python-imaging-sane - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3.2
python-imaging-tk - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3.2
python-pil - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3.2
python-pil.imagetk - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3.2
python-sane - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3.2
python3-imaging - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3.2
python3-imaging-sane - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3.2
python3-imaging-tk - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3.2
python3-pil - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3.2
python3-pil.imagetk - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3.2
python3-sane - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pillow package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.3.0-1ubuntu3.2').
